meanings.definition: Having small hairs along the margin or edge.
meanings.sent1: The ciliolate leaf felt soft to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar's body was covered in ciliolate hairs.
meanings.sent3: The ciliolate edges of the paper fluttered in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her ciliolate eyelashes framed her bright eyes.
meanings.sent5: The ciliolate texture of the fabric added a delicate touch to the dress.

meanings.sent1: The ciliolate in the garden swayed gently in the wind.
meanings.sent2: I spotted a ciliolate near the riverbank.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel nibbled on the ciliolate leaves.
meanings.sent4: The ciliolate stood out among the other plants like a dancer in a crowd.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the ciliolate filled the air with sweetness.
